landing.hero.title: Real-time seat booking
landing.hero.description: Quick and convenient event seat reservations with instant confirmation.
faq.q1: How does the real-time booking system work?
faq.a1: Using WebSocket and Redis, we instantly synchronize seat status for all users. Your selection is reserved for 15 minutes to complete payment.
faq.q2: What happens if a seat is already taken?
faq.a2: You are automatically placed in a queue. Once the seat becomes available, we’ll notify you and grant priority access for 10 minutes.
faq.a3: All transactions are protected by 256-bit encryption. We do not store your card details—payments are processed through PCI DSS certified systems.
faq.q4: Which technologies are used in the project?
faq.a4: Frontend is built with Next.js; backend uses Node.js + Socket.io, Redis for queue and timer management. UI components by shadcn/ui.
faq.a5:
• Booking confirmation 
 • Payment reminder 
 • Queue advancement 
 • Event start information
faq.a6: Yes! Cancellation is available in your profile up to 24 hours before the event. The seat is then offered to the next user in the queue.

profile.page.title: Profile
agreement.title: User Agreement for TicketFlow
agreement.section1.title: 1. General Provisions
agreement.section1.p1: 1.1. The TicketFlow service (hereinafter the 'Service') provides a platform for online ticket booking for events using real-time technologies (WebSocket).
agreement.section2.title: 2. Booking Process
agreement.section2.p1: 2.1. Selected seats are held for 15 minutes. If payment is not completed within this time, the reservation is automatically canceled.
agreement.section2.p2: 2.2. If a seat is occupied, you may join the waiting queue. The system will notify you when the seat becomes available via a WebSocket connection.
agreement.section3.title: 3. Financial Terms
agreement.section3.p1: 3.1. Full ticket payment must be made within 15 minutes after booking.
agreement.section3.p2: 3.2. Refunds are possible up to 24 hours before the event via your personal account.
agreement.section4.title: 4. Liability
agreement.section4.p1: 4.1. The Service shall not be liable for:
agreement.section4.li1: Technical failures of the WebSocket connection
agreement.section4.li2: Changes in the event program by the organizers
agreement.section4.li3: Data loss when using the Redis queue
agreement.section5.title: 5. Technical Requirements
agreement.section5.p1: 5.1. For correct operation the following is required:
agreement.section6.title: 6. Confidentiality
agreement.section6.p1: 6.1. Payment card data is processed through PCI DSS certified gateways and is not stored in our systems.
agreement.section6.p2: 6.2. Redis queue logs are stored for 30 days for auditing purposes.
